intro: Ophellantha, commonly known as the desert star or African star, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. These plants are native to southern Africa and are characterized by their succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, star-shaped flowers. Ophellantha species typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. They have a shallow root system that allows them to absorb moisture efficiently from the soil. The flowers are often brightly colored, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds.
